text:
Hi, I'm trying to move a neural network from CPU to GPU and met with this error. Seems that the the pullback failed on GPU. Just wonder anything I should do here. I'm using Zygote 0.6.3. The lossg is just a simple MSE loss function stored on GPU.
```  for (x,y) in trainDataG
    train_loss, back = Zygote.pullback(() -> lossg(x,y),gθ)
    back(one(train_loss))
  end```
> DimensionMismatch("arrays could not be broadcast to a common size; got a dimension with lengths 0 and 81")

elements.text: Hi, I'm trying to move a neural network from CPU to GPU and met with this error. Seems that the the pullback failed on GPU. Just wonder anything I should do here. I'm using Zygote 0.6.3. The lossg is just a simple MSE loss function stored on GPU.

for (x,y) in trainDataG
    train_loss, back = Zygote.pullback(() -> lossg(x,y),gθ)
    back(one(train_loss))
  end
DimensionMismatch("arrays could not be broadcast to a common size; got a dimension with lengths 0 and 81")

text: I would check the loss function, you could try with a simpler `sum(model(x))` to see where the trouble is.

to see where the trouble is.
